MC.content: “my lecture has not purely and simply missed its destination”
MC.linkedContent: “my lecture has not purely and simply missed its destination”

MC.content: starting w/ the stoikheia (letter, trait, number, proper name) & its marking insignificance (re-markable insignificance), Derrida explains how a mark’s supposed identity, solidity of its stereotypy, its indestructbility/indivisibility requires difference/division
MC.linkedContent: starting w/ the stoikheia (letter, trait, number, proper name) & its marking insignificance (re-markable insignificance), Derrida explains how a mark’s supposed identity, solidity of its stereotypy, its indestructbility/indivisibility requires difference/division

MC.content: ideal iterability allows every mark to withdraw from a context, in whole or in part, its insignificance allows it to continue to divide, proliferate identities, destinerring
MC.linkedContent: ideal iterability allows every mark to withdraw from a context, in whole or in part, its insignificance allows it to continue to divide, proliferate identities, destinerring

MPM.content: writing, as an event of signature, a signature which can only promise itself in the sense that its destination is barred, impasse of aporia
MPM.linkedContent: writing, as an event of signature, a signature which can only promise itself in the sense that its destination is barred, impasse of aporia

ROP.content: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return
ROP.linkedContent: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return

ROP.content: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)
ROP.linkedContent: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)

TR.content: reader as judge, the addressee who decides on reception/address of post card, signature left to the responsibility of the other, reader signs at moment of arrival at destination, rather than at the origin, at moment of reading rather than of writing
TR.linkedContent: reader as judge, the addressee who decides on reception/address of post card, signature left to the responsibility of the other, reader signs at moment of arrival at destination, rather than at the origin, at moment of reading rather than of writing

CHOR.content: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
CHOR.linkedContent: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
